--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Kevin Lawrence <kevin@d...> wrote:
> ...
> I =
have been playing with assertThat(). I like it a lot and will
continue 
> t=
o use it. I will continue to use it whether or not it is part of the 
> fra=
mework.

So will I, but the huge advantage of putting it into an official j=
unit
release is that it gets promoted to the public, which in turn enables
=
you to use it in various teams on various projects. Additionally, you
(and =
many other people who like assertThat) don't have to
write/maintain the sam=
e functionality everybody else is
writing/maintaining too. 

> I have also =
been experimenting with using "should" in the names of all 
> my tests. I w=
as quite surprised by the positive effect it had on the 
> quality of my te=
sts.
> ...

That sounds interesting, how exactly do you use "should"? Could=
 you
give us some examples? How did it improve the quality of your tests?
